type.note: Boutique tier - prestigious strategy/operations firm but not MBB or Big 4

tagline.source: synthesized from firm history and specialties
tagline.note: Founded as part of McKinsey, known for operations/procurement

headquarters.note: Chicago headquarters confirmed across multiple sources

founded.note: Founded 1926 by James O. McKinsey, split from McKinsey 1937, renamed A.T. Kearney 1947, rebranded to Kearney 2020

parent_company.note: Independent since 2006 management buyout from EDS

offices.note: US offices only as per schema requirements

specialties.source: kearney.com service pages, multiple consulting guides
specialties.note: Particularly known for operations, procurement, supply chain

known_for.note: McKinsey heritage + operations/procurement leadership confirmed across sources

hires_mba.note: Associate role for MBA graduates, recruits from 25+ MBA schools

career_path.note: Detailed progression with timeframes from multiple sources

travel.note: Described as intense travel schedule typical for consulting

work_hours.note: 39% work 12+ hours/day, reports of 70 hour weeks

compensation.ug.base.note: Business Analyst range $107K-$237K, using lower end for entry

compensation.ug.signing.note: Typical boutique firm signing bonus range

compensation.mba.signing.source: estimated from tier and industry data

recruiting.process.note: 2 rounds with 2-3 interviews each, confirmed across sources

recruiting.unique.note: Known for quantitative focus, operations cases, written case/Excel tests

recruiting.timeline.note: Sept-Dec for MBA, 32 day average process

byu.tip.note: Advice based on alumni distribution and firm's operations focus

notes: Complete profile successfully populated for Kearney. All required CSV data fields were present and populated. The firm has a rich history dating back to 1926 as part of McKinsey's Chicago office. Research revealed strong compensation data from Levels.fyi and multiple consulting career sites. The firm is particularly well-documented in case interview preparation resources due to its distinctive quantitative and operations-focused interview style. Notable that Marriott-specific alumni count shows 0 in CSV while general BYU has 84 all-time alumni, suggesting the alumni may have attended other BYU colleges. Kearney rebranded from A.T. Kearney to just 'Kearney' in January 2020.
